info.title: Udaru API Documentation
info.description: This page documents Udaru's API endpoints, along with their various inputs and outputs. For more information about Udaru please see the Documentation Site.

tags.name: authorization
tags.description: Manage the actions a user can perform against a resource

tags.name: private
tags.description: Endpoints that require a service key

get.summary: Ping endpoint
get.description: The GET /ping endpoint will return 200 if the server is up and running.

get.summary: List all the organizations
get.description:
The GET /authorization/organizations endpoint returns a list of all organizations.

The results are paginated. Page numbering and page limit start from 1.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: Page number, starts from 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Items per page
parameters.name: limit

post.description: The POST /authorization/organizations endpoint creates a new organization, the default organization admin policy and (if provided) its admin.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

get.summary: Fetch all the defined policies
get.description:
The GET /authorization/policies endpoint returns a list of all the defined policies
the policies will contain only the ID, version and name. No statements.

The results are paginated. Page numbering and page limit start from 1.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: Page number, starts from 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Items per page
parameters.name: limit

post.summary: Create a policy for the current user organization
post.description:
The POST /authorization/policies endpoint is a private endpoint. It can be accessed only using a service key.
This service key needs to be passed as a query string in the form "sig=<key>"

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

get.summary: Fetch all the defined shared policies
get.description:
The GET /authorization/shared-policies endpoint returns a list of all the defined policies
the policies will contain only the ID, version and name. No statements.

The results are paginated. Page numbering and page limit start from 1.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: Page number, starts from 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Items per page
parameters.name: limit

post.summary: Create a policy shared across organizations
post.description:
The POST /authorization/shared-policies endpoint is a private endpoint. It can be accessed only using a service key.
This service key needs to be passed as a query string in the form "sig=<key>"

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

get.summary: Fetch all teams from the current user organization
get.description:
The GET /authorization/teams endpoint returns a list of all teams from the current organization.

The results are paginated. Page numbering and page limit start from 1.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: Page number, starts from 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Items per page
parameters.name: limit

200.description: Note: teams users and policies are not populated in paged teams list

post.description: The POST /authorization/teams endpoint creates a new team from its payload data.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

get.summary: Fetch all users from the current user organization
get.description:
The GET /authorization/users endpoint returns a list of all users from the current organization.

The results are paginated. Page numbering and page limit start from 1.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: Page number, starts from 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Items per page
parameters.name: limit

post.description: The POST /authorization/users endpoint creates a new user given its data.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

get.summary: List all the actions a user can perform on a list of resources
get.description:
The GET /authorization/list/{userId} endpoint returns a list of all the actions a user
can perform on a given list of resources.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: User ID
parameters.name: userId

parameters.description: A list of Resources
parameters.name: resources

get.summary: Get organization
get.description: The GET /authorization/organizations/{id} endpoint returns a single organization data.

parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).

parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Organization ID

parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: Organization ID

The GET /authorization/list/{userId}/{resource} endpoint returns a list of all the actions a user
can perform on a given resource.

parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: User ID
parameters.name: userId

parameters.description: The resource that the user wants to perform the action on
parameters.name: resource

get.description: The GET /authorization/teams/{id}/nested endpoint returns a list of team data.

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).

parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Items per page
parameters.name: limit

200.description: Note: teams users and policies are not populated in nested paged teams list

get.summary: Fetch team users given its identifier
get.description:
The GET /authorization/teams/{id}/users endpoint returns the team users and pagination metadata.

The results are paginated. Page numbering and page limit start from 1.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: Team ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Page number, starts from 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Items per page
parameters.name: limit

post.summary: Replace team users with the given ones
post.description: The POST /authorization/teams/{id}/users endpoint replaces all team users. Existing team users are removed.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: Team ID
parameters.name: id

delete.description: The DELETE /authorization/teams/{id}/users endpoint removes all team users.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: Team ID
parameters.name: id

put.description: The PUT /authorization/teams/{id}/users endpoint adds one or more team users.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: Team ID
parameters.name: id

get.summary: Fetch all teams to which the user belongs to. Does not fetch parent teams.
get.description: The GET /authorization/users/{id}/teams endpoint returns a list of teams to which the user belongs to.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: User ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Page number, starts from 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Items per page
parameters.name: limit

post.description: The POST /authorization/users/{id}/teams endpoint replaces all the user teams. This can be use to move a user from a team to another (or a set of teams to another).

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: User ID
parameters.name: id

delete.description: The DELETE /authorization/users/{id}/teams endpoint deletes user from all her teams.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: User ID
parameters.name: id

get.summary: Authorize user action against a resource
get.description:
The GET /authorization/access/{userId}/{action}/{resource} endpoint answers if a user can perform an action
on a resource.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: User ID
parameters.name: userId

parameters.description: The action to check
parameters.name: action

parameters.description: The resource that the user wants to perform the action on
parameters.name: resource

parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).

parameters.name: id

post.summary: Clear and replace the policies of an organization
post.description: The POST /authorization/organizations/{id}/policies endpoint replaces all the organization policies. The existing organization policies are removed.

parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: Organization ID
parameters.name: id

delete.summary: Clear all policies of the organization
delete.description: The DELETE /authorization/organizations/{id}/policies endpoint removes all the organization policies.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: Organization ID
parameters.name: id

put.description: The PUT /authorization/organizations/{id}/policies endpoint adds one or more policies to an organization.

parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: Organization ID
parameters.name: id

delete.summary: Remove a policy associated with an organization
delete.description:
The DELETE /authorization/organizations/{id}/policies/{policyId} endpoint disassociates a specific policy from an organization.
Set optional parameter instance to delete a specific policy instance with variables, or leave blank to remove all instances with this policyId.

parameters.description: User ID of the enpoint caller
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: Organization ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Policy ID
parameters.name: policyId

delete.summary: Remove a policy associated with a team
delete.description:
The DELETE /authorization/teams/{teamId}/policies/{policyId} endpoint disassociates a policy from a team.
Set optional parameter instance to delete a specific policy instance with variables, or leave blank to remove all instances with this policyId.

parameters.description: Specify a different organization for the user who is calling the endpoint (works only for SuperUser, it's like impersonation).
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: Team ID
parameters.name: teamId

parameters.description: Policy ID
parameters.name: policyId

parameters.description: User ID
parameters.name: userId

delete.summary: Remove a policy associated with a user
delete.description:
The DELETE /authorization/users/{userId}/policies/{policyId} disassociates a policy from a user.
Set optional parameter instance to delete a specific policy instance with variables, or leave blank to remove all instances with this policyId.
